meanings.definition: To remove the bowels or intestines from (an animal)
meanings.sent1: The butcher bowelled the pig before preparing it for cooking.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian bowelled the cat during surgery to remove a blockage.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly bowelled the turkey instead of just cleaning it.
meanings.sent4: The archaeologist carefully bowelled the mummy to study its internal organs.
meanings.sent5: The hunter skillfully bowelled the deer after a successful hunt.

meanings.sent1: The bowelled fish was ready to be gutted for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The bowelled snake slithered silently through the grass.
meanings.sent3: The bowelled frog croaked happily in the pond.
meanings.sent4: The bowelled rabbit hopped around the meadow, enjoying the sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The bowelled cow grazed peacefully in the pasture.

meanings.sent1: The doctor bowelled the patient to aid in digestion.
meanings.sent2: The farmer bowelled the livestock to keep them healthy.
meanings.sent3: The gardener bowelled the plants with nutrient-rich soil.
meanings.sent4: The chef bowelled the soup with vegetables for added flavor.
meanings.sent5: The scientist bowelled the experiment with new data for analysis.
